title: What are some rock songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a really open question, I’m gonna try my best to cover a bunch of subgenres and decades (I have a really rusty English as well). We can start with Elvis, some iconic songs are “Heartbreak Hotel”, “Hound Dog”, “Love me Tender”. Surf Rock developed through the 50’s, one of the most important groups from tat genre is the Beach Boys. “Good Vibrations”, “Surfin’ USA”. “Hit the Road, Jack” is an emblematic soul song made famous by Ray Charles. The Animals’ music is important to understand this agressive tone that developed through the 60’s that would later turn into the counterculture movement led by The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, and The Beatles (In a more “pop” way). “Helter Skelter”, “Black Dog”, “Satisfaction”, “Sympathy for the Devil”, “Twist and Shout”. If you’re interested in focusing on the way guitar playing developed through Rock eras, going through all those artists is important, as the Guitar Hero concept came with the 60’s counterculture movement. Jimmy Hendrix, Jimmy Page , Angus Young (AC/DC “Riff Raff”, “Thunderstruck”, “Highway to Hell”, “Let there be rock”) would then turn into Joe Satriani, Frank Zappa, Steve Vai, John Petrucci, Paul Gilbert, etc etc etc. Pink Floyd came with psychedelic Rock and HUGE productions (its theatrical ways have their roots in artists like David Bowie), “Comfortably numb”, “Money”, “Hey you”, “Another brick in te wall”. I would suggest hearing Glam Rock and Metal as well, with KISS “Rock and Roll all night”, “Heaven’s on fire”, as well as Mötley Crüe, Bon Jovi, etc. Some Prog Rock bands are Yes (“Owner of a Lonely Heart”), Toto (“Africa”, “Hold the line”), Rush (“YYZ”). Metal music comes in a lot of flavors, I personally started as lots of kids with Metallica and Megadeth, which means I listened to a lot of Thrash Metal from the 80’s, (“Hit the Lights”, “The Mechanix or The four horsemen”, “One”, “Master of Puppets”, “Metal Militia”, “Tornado of Souls”), listening to Black Sabbath and Diamond Head will show you some of their influences. you can also check on Dream Theater (Prog Metal), Testament, Warrant, Mr. Big, Extreme (Funk Rock, as well as other genres) etc etc etc. Brit Rock also derived in bands like Arctic Monkeys (“Bet you look good on the dancefloor”, “Dancing Shoes”). Oasis (“Wonderwall”, “Stop crying your heart out”) , The Strokes, The Kooks. I forgot Deep Purple, which combined orchestral music, jazz, blues and rock (“Smoke on the water”, “When a blind mand cries”, “Highway star”, and a thousand songs more). Queen… man, Queen, no comments, just listen to them (“Bohemian Rhapsody”, “Tie your mother down”, “Ogre Battle”, “Don’t Stop me Now”, “One Vision”, “Crazy Little Thing Called Love”) Man, I could keep on mentioning bands and songs, and I’m sure I forgot lots of iconic rock artists and bands, I have played guitar for 11 years now. One of my favorite bands is Mr. Big by the way (“Daddy, Brother, Lover, Little boy”, “Take a walk”, “Rock and Roll over”). As you can see Rock music is more than just a genre. Finally, as a mexican I can suggest you hear Caifanes, Café Tacuba, Agora, Maná, Jaguares, El Tri. And lots of other artists that adopted Rock music as a way of expression. I wish you luck in this amazing journey (THE WHO, LISTEN TO THE WHO) that is Rock Music.

Rock n Roll Singer by AC/DC, Rock Bottom by UFO, Whiskey in jar by Thin Lizzy, Fight the good fight by Triumph, Into the void by Black Sabbath, Death Row by Bob Seger, War Machine by Kiss, Showdown by ELO, Hallowed be thy name by Iron Maiden, AM i evil by Diamondhead, just to name a few
